alert.note: Alert for Alger; Northern Schoolcraft (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued February 19 at 3:30AM EST until February 19 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph will cause whiteout conditions. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow and blowing snow expected. additional snow accumulation up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Alger and Northern Schoolcraft Counties. * WHEN...For the Blizzard Warning, until 7 AM EST this morning. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 7 AM this morning to 1 PM EST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on near impossible travel with extreme blowing of snow and whiteout conditions through sunrise. Gusty winds could bring down trees and cause power outages. The cold wind chills as low as 15 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Slow down and use caution while traveling.
